member.name: T:Topper.HostSettings
member.summary: Represents additional settings

member.name: M:Topper.HostSettings.EnableParallelStartup
member.summary: Enables parallel execution of service initializers. By default, services are serially initialized in the order in which they're added. Calling this method makes all initialization functions run in parallel.

member.name: M:Topper.HostSettings.EnableParallelShutdown
member.summary: Enables parallel execution of service disposal. By default, services are serially disposed in the opposite order of which they're added. Calling this method makes all dispose functions run in parallel.

member.name: T:Topper.ServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Create an instance of this one and add services to it by calling or . When you have added enough services to it, call

member.name: M:Topper.ServiceConfiguration.Configure(System.Action{Topper.HostSettings})
member.summary: Invokes configuration callback that makes it possible to further customize things

member.name: M:Topper.ServiceConfiguration.Add(System.String,System.Func{System.IDisposable})
member.summary: Adds the given service function with the given name

member.name: M:Topper.ServiceConfiguration.Add(System.String,System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.IDisposable}})
member.summary: Adds the given async service function with the given name

member.name: M:Topper.ServiceConfiguration.Add(System.String,System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.IDisposable}})
member.summary: Adds the given async service function with the given name, passing a cancellation token in

member.name: T:Topper.Logging.ILog
member.summary: Simple interface that represent a logger.

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.ILog.Log(Topper.Logging.LogLevel,System.Func{System.String},System.Exception,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message the specified log level.
member.param: Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks: Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties. To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.name: T:Topper.Logging.ILogProvider
member.summary: Represents a way to get a

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.ILogProvider.GetLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the specified named logger.
member.returns: The logger reference.

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.ILogProvider.OpenNestedContext(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a nested diagnostics context. Not supported in EntLib logging.
member.param: The message to add to the diagnostics context.
member.returns: A disposable that when disposed removes the message from the context.

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.ILogProvider.OpenMappedContext(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Opens a mapped diagnostics context. Not supported in EntLib logging.
member.param: Determines whether to call the destructor or not.
member.returns: A disposable that when disposed removes the map from the context.

member.summary: Sets an action that is invoked when a consumer of your library has called SetCurrentLogProvider. It is important that hook into this if you are using child libraries (especially ilmerged ones) that are using LibLog (or other logging abstraction) so you adapt and delegate to them.

member.name: T:Topper.Logging.LogProviders.LibLogException
member.summary: Exception thrown by LibLog.

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.LogProviders.LibLogException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new LibLogException with the specified message.

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.LogProviders.LibLogException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new LibLogException with the specified message and inner exception.

member.name: M:Topper.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary: Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number. "Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.
